suncertify.server.impl
Class RemoteData

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.commons.LoggingObject
      suncertify.server.impl.RemoteData
All Implemented Interfaces:
Remote, Unreferenced, RemoteDBAccess
public class RemoteData
extends LoggingObject
implements RemoteDBAccess, Unreferenced

Remote version of class Data. This class is not directly instantiable. Instances of this class are meant to be created by a factory on client demand.
Instances of this class are not bound to a RMI registry so they are not shared among several clients (also to avoid the registry reference and be able to be unreference-notified).
They can be used to represent client identity.

Version:
1.0 29/09/2010
Author:
Ignacio del Valle Alles

                  throws DuplicateKeyException

createRecord in interface RemoteDBAccess
Parameters:
data - the given data.

the record number of the new record.

DuplicateKeyException - if already exists a record with the same key.

                         long lockCookie)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException,
                         SecurityException
Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse.

Specified by:
deleteRecord in interface RemoteDBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the record number.
lockCookie - the cookie value.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record does not exist.
SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie.

findByCriteria

public long[] findByCriteria(String[] criteria)
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy").

Specified by:
findByCriteria in interface RemoteDBAccess
Parameters:
criteria - the filter criteria array.
Returns:
the array of record numbers.

lockRecord

public long lockRecord(long recNo)
                throws RecordNotFoundException
Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

Specified by:
lockRecord in interface RemoteDBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the record number.
Returns:
a cookie value. A long that demonstrate the lock ownership.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record does not exist.

an array where each element is a record value.

unlock

public void unlock(long recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws SecurityException
Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException.

Specified by:
unlock in interface RemoteDBAccess
Parameters:
recNo - the record number.
cookie - the result of lockRecord(recNo) execution.
Throws:
SecurityException - if the cookie is not valid.

isRejectCalls

public boolean isRejectCalls()
Returns reject calls state.

Returns:
true if the instance is set to reject remote incoming calls. Used to ensure a clean shutdown of the server.

setRejectCalls

public void setRejectCalls(boolean rejectCalls)
Sets the reject calls state. Set to true in server shutdown to avoid new executing threads.

Parameters:
rejectCalls - true to make the instance reject all remote incoming calls.

public List<Thread> getPendingThreads()
Returns all the threads that are currently executing on this instance.

the thread list.

See Also:
Unreferenced

unreferenced

public void unreferenced()
This method is called by the RMI runtime when no remote clients hold a reference to this instance. Since instances of this class are not bound to the registry and served exclusively by the remote factory (see {$link RemoteDBAccessFactory}), one client can reference an instance, so this method acts as a listener for client lost of communication, and it is used to clean resources, like for example the locks held by the client.

Specified by:
unreferenced in interface Unreferenced
